EDINBURGH , 3 12 CHESTER STREET, TELEPHONE EDINBURGH 324-47 (3 LINES) YOUR REF OUR REF :<iT For the attention of Mr. Qwea-Jonea The India Office, Whitehall, S.W.l. 9th September, 1946 ^ hb: h t-yn $ Dear Sirs, re : KOWAIT Further to our telephone conversation with Mr, Qwen- Jones,we hereby apply for permission for the following members of 1 ^ our staff to enter Kowait Mr. Stanley Lawson-Clarke. Mr. Y/alter Alston. Mr. Lawson-Clarke and Mr. Alston have to travel to Kowait on the 20th September at the invitation of the Kowait Oil Company, in connection with possible civil engineering construction/ works for that Company. The duration of their visit would be approximately 4/6 weeks, and the Kowait Oil Company have offered seats in their own private plane. The entire expense of the trip will be borne by this Company, and we should oe 0 lad if you would kindly endeavour to expedite the necessary permission. Yours faithfully. Request of Messrs. George vYimpey and Co.,Ltd, for information on taxation or import duty restrictions in Kuwa it. 2, The firm would not he liable to pay any tax to the huwait Government on income accruing from civil engineering work in Kuwait. 3. Only import restrictions are prohibition of the importation of alcohol and pigs and their products. Liquor in limited quantities for personal consumption by Europeans can be imported on permits granted by the Political Agent. The import duty is 6t>» on all other commodities unless required for the Political Agency or the Kuwait Cil Company. Sd. W.R.HAY. EDINBURGH . 3 12,CHESTER STREET, TELEPHONE EDINBURGH 324A7 (3 LINES). YOUR REF OUR REF ?o:i/EA 9th July, 1946. Jp. p.h Me l pi- - A' * v r / F.A.K. Harrison, Esq., India Office, Whi tehall. Dear Sir, With reference to our conversation of this morning, we should he grateful if you could ob tain for us information on taxation or import duty restrictions in connection with^possible civil engineering contracting operations In Kov/eit. As explained, we are in discussion with the Koweit Oil Company on the subject of carrying out civil engineering work for them in their concession area in Koweit and we understand from Mr. Kemp of the Oil Company that as far as work for them is. concerned the position is quite clear and_taxation and import duties would not affect us. it is con ceivable, however, that once we were established in Koweit for the c il Company we might wish to, or be invited to, carry out constructional work for other clients, e*g« the Koweit iOvernment. or other authorities. It is in these categories that possibly some taxation and import restrictions may/ Gontd....may not ap considerat any inform ^ able to obmav not apply. It would be helpful to us in our consideration if you could kindly let us .iave any information on this aspect that you ma;; oe qVi 1 o -hr* obt.n 1 n . Yours faithfully, GEOKjE WIMPEY & CO., LIMITED. Director.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 4728/46 'Requests of Messrs Wimpey and Co Ltd for information on taxation or import duty restrictions in Kuwait'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 29; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence regarding enquiries made by George Wimpey and Company Limited with the India Office (Francis Anthony Kitchener Harrison), Political Resident in the Persian Gulf and the Political Agent at Kuwait on taxation or import duty restrictions. The correspondence also contains a request for clarification on the position of the company should they wish to enter into contracts with other clients in Koweit [Kuwait] once they have become established. This correspondence followed previous discussions, not included in the file, with the Koweit Oil Company [Kuwait Oil Company] to carry out civil engineering work for George Wimpey and Company Limited.
